content: ***this crochet pattern is available for free on my website or you can download it here as a print-optimized ad-free pdf for your convenience *** **difficulty ** intermediate/advanced *techniques used bean stitch bobble stitch picot single_crochet working in the 3rd loop of an half_double_crochet modified alpine stitch* **materials needed ** 4mm g hook or hook needed to obtain gauge #3 light weight baby bee sweet delight yarn in give me the moon oatmeal color green light green color and angel white color or colors of your choice -2010 yards 685 oatmeal 530 green 795 white - 36 x 40 baby blanket -2560 yards 970 oatmeal 650 green 940 white - 40 x 40 receiving blanket -2930 yards 970 oatmeal 1040 green 920 white - crib blanket/lapghan -3200 yards 1060 oatmeal 1140 green 1000 white - toddler blanket -4900 yards 1590 oatmeal 1510 green 1800 white - small throw -6530 yards 1900 oatmeal 2170 green 2460 white - large throw -8970 yards 2300 oatmeal 2950 green 3720 white - twin blanket -9920 yards 2520 oatmeal 3270 green 4130 white - double bed blanket yarn needle scissors measuring tape blocking boards stitch markers **stitches used ** slip_stitch = slip_stitch chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet rsc = reverse single_crochet crab stitch **additional terms ** *working in the 3rd loop of an half_double_crochet * look at the top of the stitch and locate the sideways v bend the stitch to look at the back and you should see another v made by the yarn over you ll be working into the back loop of that v this is the yarn over and is called the 3rd loop *bean stitch * insert hook into designated stitch yo draw up loop 3 times yo draw through all 6 loops on hook chain 1 here s a video https //www youtube com/watch v=hvsmjh2wyac *bobble stitch * yo insert hook into stitch pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 5 times yo draw through 4 loops yo draw through all remaining loops on hook *picot single_crochet psc also known as the granule stitch * insert hook yo pull up a loop yo draw through 1 loop 3 times to make a chain 3 then yo and draw through both loops on the hook pull your chain-3 space towards the front of your work instead of pushing it toward the back *chainless starting half_double_crochet * with slip knot on hook yo insert hook into first stitch of row yo draw up a loop yo draw through all 3 loops on hook space/sps = space/spaces chain/chs = chain/chains prev = previous skip = skip **gauge ** 16 single_crochet in 4 across 20 row gives 4 of height with 4mm hook **measurements ** * these are approximate measurements * baby blanket 36 x 40 crib/lapghan 36 x 54 receiving blanket 40 x 40 toddler blanket 40 x 54 small throw 52 x 64 large throw 60 x
